result.execSummary:
The defendant Fredrick Robert Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
May not use or possess alcohol.
Stay out of bars and taverns.
May not possess controlled substances.  If taking prescribed medications, must remain in conformity with doctor's prescription.
May not operate a motor vehicle without a driver's license.

Follow thru with any treatment recommended.
Complete victim impact panel.
AODA assessment and treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random testing for drugs and alcohol.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide a DNA sample if not previously provided.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised of voting ineligibility.

Pay  restitution of $17.50 to City of West Allis, plus DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  To be taken from DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
***3/19/2015  Clarification and correction to 3/12/15 entry: $17.50 is not restitution.  It's to be paid by defendant to the City of West Allis for the blood draw.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fredrick Robert Schmitt

records.addlTxt: Packet of information in support of defendant, including certificates and letters, received and filed.
Defense counsel requested a scheduling date.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Fredrick Robert Schmitt not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Fredrick Robert Schmitt not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a bail hearing.  File retained in court.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied defense request for modification of bail. Bail remains the same. Defense counsel will argue bail at the next court date.

Defendant Fredrick Robert Schmitt in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Fredrick Robert Schmitt in custody.  Ronald Dague on behalf of James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for preliminary hearing.   Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty. Case adjourned to Branch 20. Scheduling Conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by  portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Fredrick Robert Schmitt in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Fredrick Robert Schmitt in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
